pages.text: RF (aka Redstone Flux) was the original concept for power in modded Minecraft. Now, it is unified with the introduction of FE, also known as Forge Energy. $(br2)Currently there are multiple ways of generating FE in the modpack.

The two easiest options for generating FE would be the following blocks: $(li)Alternator (Create Crafts & Additions) $(li)Stirling Dynamo (Thermal Series) $(br2)You can then store this energy with either the Accumulator or a Redstone Flux Cell. $(br2)You can see the items individually over the next few pages.
This is the Alternator, introduced with Create Crafts & Additions. It requires a minimum of 32 RPM to be able to generate FE.
The Stirling Dynamo only needs furnace consumable fuels such as coal, charcoal, etc.

This requires some setup to input power into as it requires Connectors to be placed on top of the Accumulator block. $(br2)Those Connectors then need to be linked with either a wire from a Gold Spool or Copper Spool.
You may need the Wrench to help assist in the setup process and correctly set up the Connectors. $(br2)Thermal's Stirling Dynamo can also be used to power the Accumulator directly.

This is the Redstone Flux Cell and it is highly customizable but may require additional setup as it needs to know which side to use as RF intake, which side to use as RF output and how much to discharge per tick. $(br2)It's highly specific.
